release.action: Added cPath Administrator Functionality: Administrator can now run the full text indexer, and upload files for import. Administrator can also monitor long-term tasks, such as importing of large PSI-MI XML documents. Admin page is now also password-protected.
Created cPath Diagnostics page to perform routine tests and verify correct installation.
Added support for loading of external references. Users can use the admin.pl command line utility or the Admin page to import references.
Added generic framework for pre-computing specific cPath queries. Queries can be run from the admin.pl script or set to run on a *nix cron job.
Performed load-testing via Apache JMeter. JMeter config scripts are now available in config/cpath_load_testing_plan.jmx.
Added new page for displaying Interactor specific information, including: name, organism, and all external references.
Updated the Installation notes to include information re: cPath diagnostics page, Tiny Monitor, and "where to look when things to wrong."

actions.action: Add getExternalReferences to query API. This would allow e.g. Cytoscape to easily create external links.

Add support to cPath and data services layer for importing PSI-MI files that contain interactions with more than two proteins (e.g. 5 protein complex). This would allow us to import data from the PIN database in the Tempst lab at MSKCC (http://pin.mskcc.org).
Index all interactions (right now, we only index interactors). Requires changes to web interface.
Build a Front-end administrative interface to the External Database Tables (more details are included in phase 6 doc, before being deferred)
Add new query: query by experimental method (e.g. all the data from two-hybrid).
Provide query API functionality to get a list of valid query API commands. E.g. for getInteractionsBySource, we could have getValidSources.
For HTML front end of cPath query API: paginate results (only text index results currently paginated).

Support content-length calculation of PSI-MI queries, where possible, to support more accurate progress metering on the client side. We might be able to easily do it for queries that are cached and for the precomputed queries. For queries that aren't, we could at least provide updates of the parsing progress as it happens (Rob's idea).

Implement a full statistics page. This could be precomputed regularly (e.g. weekly), not computed on the fly. The best example of a stats page is currently the MINT page: http://160.80.34.4/mint/statistics/statistics.php.
Prevent against cross-scripting vulnerability (validate user input before use).
Set up auto-emails upon fatal cPath errors (how does a user deal with errors?).
Add an Ontology object to the dataservices bio package to allow retrieval of Gene Ontology type information.
Add Gene Name/Synonym Look up to data services (requires a back-end, may be able to use Entrez Gene DB).
Create a service for reading in Cytoscape node/edge attributes to go with sif reader.
Create an "About Data Services PlugIn", with version #, list of all registered (more details are included in phase 6 doc, before being deferred)
Resurrect the GRID Plugin - retrieves data from GRID directly into Cytoscape.
